results.firPara: Will Liverpools miserable 2017 continue against Arsenal? Could Hull do the double over Leicester? Will Sunderland be able to stop Leroy Sané?
results.secPara: Will Liverpools miserable 2017 continue against Arsenal? Could Hull do the double over Leicester? Will Sunderland be able to stop Leroy Sané?
results.webTitle: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend

results.firPara: Video technology could be introduced into English football next season as early as the Community Shield, with FA Cup ties also being targeted as possibilities for its trial use.
results.secPara: The International Football Association Board is set to discuss live trials of video reviews, in matches scheduled by the Football Association, during its annual general meeting on Friday. The Wembley meeting will see the merits of technology outlined and the Ifab is expected to give the concept its approval in time for next years World Cup.
results.webTitle: Video review system could be used in English football next season

results.firPara: • Former Liverpool striker Fernando Torres taken off on stretcher
results.secPara: The Atlético Madrid striker Fernando Torres was taken to hospital after suffering a head injury in Thursdays 1-1 draw with Deportivo La Coruña.
results.webTitle: Fernando Torres in hospital with head injury suffered during Atlético match

results.firPara: Arsène Wenger has sacrificed his life during his long tenure at Arsenal to the extent that he says it has been akin to joining the priesthood. The clubs manager describes himself as a specialist in masochism and he is perfectly clear that 90% of the job is aggravation.
results.secPara: At the age of 67, and with a vocal element of the Arsenal support baying for him to quit when his contract expires in the summer, it is easy to wonder why on earth he would want to continue. But there are times when Wenger speaks with such power about his chosen path that it is plain he could not live without it.
results.webTitle: ‘Masochist’ Arsène Wenger admits his job hurts but hints at staying at Arsenal

results.firPara: What journeyman has won what Ive won? What journeyman has played at the clubs that Ive played at?
results.secPara: Colin Kazim-Richards has a point. He is not a journeyman, he is simply too good to be put in that bracket; his CV is far too rich. He is, however, a man on a journey. After six months at Coritiba in Brazil at the end of last year, he recently made the switch across the country to Corinthians in São Paulo. It is his 13th club in as many years, across seven different countries.
results.webTitle: Colin Kazim-Richards: ‘A lot of my cousins and friends are in jail or dead’

results.firPara: However much you liked it, a former Manchester City director once said, you wouldnt put the man who runs your corner shop in charge of a multinational. He was explaining his belief that City should have replaced Joe Royle as soon as he had led City to promotion, but his argument has more general application.
results.secPara: It is an awkward truth because it does not fit with the comfortably meritocratic notion that you can work your way up from the bottom. Nor does it fit with the manager-as-messiah image that still dominates the English conception of the role. There is a sense we are still looking for the next Herbert Chapman, Sir Matt Busby, Bill Shankly, Don Revie or Brian Clough who can pick up a struggling club and almost by force of personality transform them into champions.
results.webTitle: The Ranieri theory: liberation from discipline leads to success – and decay | Jonathan Wilson

results.firPara: Today RIP Lisbon Lion Tommy Gemmell (1943-2017)
results.secPara: Today RIP Lisbon Lion Tommy Gemmell (1943-2017)
results.webTitle: A marauding left-back before marauding left-backs were fashionable

results.firPara: The Fifa president, Gianni Infantino, has made only a marginal improvement to football supporters confidence in the games world governing body during his year in charge, according to a survey by the opinion platform Forza Football endorsed by the anti-corruption organisation Transparency International.
results.secPara: Of 25,000 supporters in 50 countries who responded to the survey, 98% said they remain concerned about corruption at Fifa, and only 26% said they believed Infantino had restored trust in the organisation.
results.webTitle: Trust in Fifa has improved only slightly under Gianni Infantino, survey finds

results.firPara: Five ordered to pay £28,000 court fees incurred by former South Yorkshire chief constable David Crompton
results.secPara: A crowdfunding appeal has been set up for five people whose relatives died in the 1989 Hillsborough disaster, after a judge ordered them to pay the £28,000 legal costs of former South Yorkshire police chief constable David Crompton.
results.webTitle: Hillsborough families to crowdfund after being hit with police chief's costs

results.firPara: At the press conference before Barcelonas match with Sporting Gijón on Wednesday Luis Enrique was asked if he felt tired, worn out by the demands of being manager at the Camp Nou. He had been a little edgy of late, after all – even for him. No, he said, a little pointedly, which is how he says a lot of things, Im pletórico. Plethoric, full of energy.
results.secPara: At the press conference after Barcelonas match with Sporting Gijón on Wednesday night, they had finished asking Luis Enrique questions when he announced that he was leaving at the end of the season. I need to rest, he said.
results.webTitle: Barcelona open-mouthed, not broken-hearted, at Luis Enrique’s imminent exit
